<small>Also see: [[H0479]]</small>

 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דֵּךְ‎</span> **demonstrative pronoun masculine** ==this==, **feminine** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דָּח‎</span>; only Ezra; Daniel uses <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּכֵּן‎</span> (Egyptian and Cappadocian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎זך‎</span> ([[BDB#CIS|CIS]]<sup>ii. 151 RŠS:361</sup> [[BDB#B|B]] [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>Pap.</sup> (feminine <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דכא‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דכי‎</span> ib.<sup>F 6, 9</sup>), [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>Eph. i. 67</sup>); [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דֵּיכֵי‎</span>, feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּח‎</span>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> From <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎זֶה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דָּא‎</span> (feminine), with the affix <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ך‎</span> ([[BDB#W|W]]<sup>CG 110</sup>), thus literally = German ***dieser da.*** The plural is <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִלֵּח‎</span>, q. v.); — ***this*** (always after its substantive), [[Ezra.5.16|Ezra 5:16]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שֵׁשְׁבַּצַּר דֵח‎</span>, v[[Ezra.5.17|Ezra 5:17]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בֵּיתאֱֿלָהָא דֵח‎</span>, [[Ezra.6.7|Ezra 6:7]]; [[Ezra.6.8|Ezra 6:8]]; [[Ezra.6.12|Ezra 6:12]] feminine [[Ezra.4.13|Ezra 4:13]]; [[Ezra.4.15|Ezra 4:15]]; [[Ezra.4.16|Ezra 4:16]] (twice in verse); [[Ezra.4.19|Ezra 4:19]]; [[Ezra.4.21|Ezra 4:21]] all <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קִרְיְתָא דָח‎</span>, [[Ezra.5.8|Ezra 5:8]].
